contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2010}} {{Infobox astronaut | name =Vasily Vasiliyevich Tsibliyev | image =Tsibliyev.jpg | type =Cosmonaut | nationality =[[Russia]]n | birth_date =February 20, 1954 | birth_place =[[Orekhovka]], [[Crimea]], [[USSR]] (now [[Ukraine]]) | occupation =[[aviator|Pilot]] | rank =[[Lieutenant General]], [[Russian Air Force]] | selection =[[List of astronauts by selection#1987|1987]] | time =381d 15h 52m | mission =[[Soyuz TM-17]], [[Soyuz TM-25]] | insignia = | awards = <imagemap>File:Hero of the Russian Federation medal.png|20px|Hero of the Russian Federation default [[Hero of the Russian Federation]] desc none</imagemap> |}} '''Vasily Vasiliyevich Tsibliyev''' ({{lang-ru|Василий Василиевич Циблиев}}); born on February 20, 1954) is a [[Russia]]n [[cosmonaut]]. He was selected as a cosmonaut on March 26, 1987. Tsibliyev flew as Commander on [[Soyuz TM-17]] from July 1, 1993 to January 14, 1994 and on [[Soyuz TM-25]] from February 2, 1997 to August 14 of the same year. He retired on June 19, 1998. Tsibliyev is currently Chief of the [[Yuri Gagarin Cosmonauts Training Center]] at Star City, Russia. <!-- can someone who reads Russian add the correct date he became commander? I cannot tell if it was 2003 or 2004 from the machine-translation of his GCTC biography. --> Tsibliyev is married with two children. Tsibliyev was the commander in charge of ''[[Mir]]'' when it was hit by a ''[[Progress (spacecraft)|Progress]]'' spacecraft in 1997. ==Honours and awards== {{Russian|Циблиев, Василий Васильевич}} * [[Hero of the Russian Federation]] (14 January 1994) - for courage and heroism displayed during spaceflight on the orbital scientific research complex ''Mir'' * [[Order of Merit for the Fatherland]], 3rd class (10 April 1998) - for courage and heroism displayed during prolonged space flight on the orbital scientific research complex ''Mir'' * [[Medal "For Merit in Space Exploration"]] (12 April 2011) - for the great achievements in the field of research, development and use of outer space, many years of diligent work, public activities * [[Medal for Battle Merit]] * [[Medal "For Distinction in Military Service"]], 2nd class * Medal "For Strengthening brotherhood in arms" (Bulgaria) * [[NASA Exceptional Public Service Medal]] * [[Pilot-Cosmonaut of the Russian Federation]] (14 January 1994) - for the successful implementation of spaceflight on the orbital scientific research complex ''Mir'' and expressed at high level of professionalism * Prize Laureate Vladimir Vysotsky's "Own Track" ==External links== * [http://www.gctc.ru/eng/index.html Yuri Gagarin Cosmonaut Training Center] * [http://www.gctc.ru/biogr/cibleev.html Biography and C.V. on GCTC's web site (in Russian)]. * Current developments at GCTC: [http://www.gctc.ru/eng/etap/default.htm here]. * [http://spaceflight.nasa.gov/history/shuttle-mir/multimedia/video/v-111.mpg Onboard video from NASA]. * [http://spaceflight.nasa.gov/history/shuttle-mir/people/p-c-tsibliev.htm Biographical note from NASA on Shuttle-Mir program]. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Tsibliyev, Vasily | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Russian cosmonaut | DATE OF BIRTH = February 20, 1954 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Orekhovka]], [[Crimea]], [[USSR]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tsibliyev, Vasily}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Crimea]] [[Category:Russian cosmonauts]] [[Category:Heroes of the Russian Federation]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Merit for the Fatherland, 3rd class]] [[Category:Pilot-Cosmonauts of the Russian Federation]] [[Category:Recipients of the Medal For Merit in Space Exploration]] {{Astronaut-stub}} {{russia-bio-stub}}
